Name: Ah-So
Description:
The objective is to capture as many of your opponent's pieces as possible. This is done by sandwiching one or more of his pieces between two of yours.

In addition to regular pieces, each player receives four face pieces. There are five home dots at the center of the board. Each face piece placed next to a home dot scores two points at the end of a game. All other pieces score one point. The game ends when all the pieces are played or when neither player can make a move.

Tradition requires the winning player to suck in his breath and say "ah- s-o-o-o-o" at the end of the game.

Name: Colours and Guns
Description:
Colours & Guns an 80 page set of land based rules system designed for 10 mm Napoleonic figures. They will whet your appetite for Napoleonic wargaming in our speciality scale, 10 mm. The rules are simple enough to get a grasp of quickly but have enough variety and complexity to make it a game you'll want to play again and again. With so many nations to choose from where will you begin……? The rules are choc full of photos, diagrams, army lists and sketches of some of the most famous Commanders of the day. We've placed the quick play sheet on the back cover, so they don't take up much room on the table and the spine of the book stays neat. Units are infantry battalions, cavalry regiments or batteries of guns.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Suisse
Description: The Tour de Suisse is a 6-stage race on the UCI World Tour calendar taking place annually in June

Name: Triathlon
Description:
A trick taker for three players in which you try to complete a "triathlon" by accomplishing three tasks: winning a number of tricks equal to a multiple of three (3, 6, 9, or 12 tricks,) winning the last trick of the hand, and winning the "middling" number of tricks (neither the least or the most.)

If you complete a triathlon in one hand, you immediately win! Otherwise, whichever player is able to first complete three triathlons across multiple hands wins.

The game is played with a 39 card deck: A-6 in four suits, plus three jokers.

—user summary

Name: Magnytour Profil: Tour Down Under
Description:
The Tour Down Under is a professional cycling stage race run around the Australian city of Adelaide. 
Run for the first time in 1999, since 2008 it has been the first round on the UCI ProTour calendar, today the World Tour.

A race in 5 stages of 150 km each.

Name: Magnytour Profil: Paris-Nice
Description:
Paris-Nice is a French professional stage cycling race.

Created in 1933, it is organized by Amaury Sport Organization.

It takes place in March for eight days, making it the first major stage race of the year in Europe.

Name: Magnytour Profil: Course Tirreno-Adriatico
Description:
The between two seas Tirreno-Adriatico race offers some very nice playing profiles.

The stage race profile consists of 3 stage profiles, it is Magnytour-specific and is updated annually.

Name: Magnytour Profil: Course Classique – Championnat du Monde
Description:
The profile is specific for each race and adapted to the Magnytour game. It is updated every year. You can therefore order the new edition every year.

The 2019 edition of the UCI Road World Championships – Men's road race was help in Yorkshire.

Name: Doctor! Doctor!: Man vs Meeple Season 3 Promo Card
Description:
A single Promo card for Doctor! Doctor! Mix in with the rest of the cards and proceed as usual.

The card is worth 7 VP. Requirements: 2 lungs, 1 heart, 1 bone.
Blood Pressure = 6

Originally available through the Man vs Meeple's 2020 Kickstarter.

Name: BATSU!: The Punishment Card Game
Description:
BATSU! is a party card game where players compete in hilarious challenges to avoid humiliating or mildly painful punishments!


     Based on the hit live Japanese punishment game show in NYC and Chicago
     Put your “funny” friends to the test in challenges while risking a BATSU!
     Everyone wins, except the loser!


Compete In Challenges
Each round a different player is the judge. The judge of the round draws a Challenge Card for the other players to compete in. These could be anything from telling a story to acting as props for a play.

Audience Suggestions
There is a deck of audience suggestions to switch things up every time a challenge is drawn. Different challenges require different types of suggestions. For example, the judge may draw a Place Card so the scene could take place anywhere from a baseball field to Mars.

Hilarious Punishments
The judge then decides which player did the worst and deserves to be punished, Japanese game show style! It could be something humiliating like calling a friend to tell an embarrassing story about you, or painful like getting an arm hair plucked out! In the end, players are either funny or get punished!

Name: Heathcliff .... Munch Out Board Game Card Game
Description:
Based on the comic strip by George lately. Be the first to collect a complete 10 course meal for Heathcliff to eat.


     Players roll dice to move across the board
     Collect 9 numbered meals or 8 and the joker-card
     Use shortcuts to get to the dishes first or trade meals with adjacent players
     The first player to serve all 9 dishes to Heathcliff wins

Name: Hexa Würfel-Domino
Description:
Hexa without a die:
All 48 tokens are mixed up and placed upside down on the central area of the game board. The players chose a token and set it on the corresponding space in the area with the border of their color. If a token can't be placed, it ist placed upside down beside the game board and the next player get his turn. When the central spaces are empty, the tokens beside the game board are mixed up and placed in the central area to resume play. The first player to place 12 tokens in the area of his color wins the game.

Hexa with a die:
All 48 tokens are mixed up and placed upside down on the central area of the game board. When all tokens are placed, they are turned to show their nominations. Now the players roll a die ant take a corresponding token to pace in their area. If the token lay on a corresponding center space, the player gets another turn. On the roll of a 6 the player gets another turn too. If his two sixes are already covered, the 6 count as a wildcard. The first player to place 12 tokens in the area of his color wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Fussball-Spiel zu Hause
Description:
Each player has 11 pawns (green vs. yellow). The ball is represented by a black pawn. Playing time is 2x15 minutes.
The movement (not diagonally) of the ball and the player pawns is determined by a die. Only at the roll of a 6 the ball may move over other pawns. If the ball stops in front of a pawn of the same team or the pawn moves behind the ball, the player may roll again.
The player with the most goals wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Funny Pages: A Comical Puzzle Game
Description:
Use your wits, code-breaking skills, and real-world research to crack a series of challenges hidden in hilarious cartoon panels.

If you can uncover their mysteries and piece together the big picture, you may be able to smash open an enigmatic cold case of the missing cartoonist.

—description from publisher

Name: Spellslingers X Otherworlds
Description:
Spellslingers X Otherworlds is an exciting and new stand alone expansion for Spellslingers! 
You don't need to have any knowledge of Spellslingers or Otherworlds to completely enjoy this game!

This new set contains 60 cards, 12 of which are characters! Every card is inspired by the Otherworlds tabletop RPG.

The other 48 cards are spells, each relating to one of the 12 characters, adding more story to the game than ever before!

Name: Line-ups
Description:
Line-ups is an N-in-a-row game played on a 12x12 grid. Players take turns marking one space. When a player completes one or more rows of three, four, or five spaces in a line they score it. A scored row may be extended to make a longer row, but not an overlapping row of the same size.

The winner is the first player to score eight rows of three, five rows of four, or one row of five.

To offset the first-player advantage players may optionally not count the first row of three scored by that player.

Name: Last Ditch: A Strategy Game
Description:
Last Ditch is played on a free-form "board" made of intersecting straight lines with a closed border - the lines are the "ditches" of the title.

On a turn a player "fills" a ditch by scribbling over it, but if the ditch being filled intersects an already-filled ditch, it stops there.

The player filling the last ditch wins the game.

Name: Prose Bowl
Description:
Prose Bowl is played with a set of 21 letters; the rules suggest choosing the first 21 from some piece of written material.

A procedure is given for drafting letters from the set which results in each player having ten. The remaining letter is the "team captain" for both players.

The players then have three minutes to make words from their letters; every word must include the captain. Points are awarded based on word length and use of rare letters.

A series of three games can be played, in which case the teams are kept but the loser of a game chooses any letter as the new captain for both teams.

Name: Grabolo 3D
Description:
Prove that you have the best eyes and the fastest hands at the table.

A roll of the dice determines the combination of color and shape, so react quickly.

Play your favorite game in a new way – wooden pawns!

Grabolo 3D – wild fun for everyone!

Name: In Side Out
Description:
One player shuffles all the cards, put them in a stack face down in the center of the table, and draws the top three cards and lays them face up around the center stack. He then begins the first round by turning the top card of the deck face up. Every card has one large symbol in the center and one smaller symbol in a ring around the center. There are 10 different symbols and may be in one of 8 different colors. The task of all participants is to search for the icon from the center of the final flipped card on the outer circle of the other three visible cards. The paired cards must match in both shape and color. As soon as one of the opponents finds such a card, he must quickly slap his palm on it and take the card.

It can very easily happen that there is no matching card on the table. In this case the next player add the central card to other three and flips over a new card to be matched with those four.

The game continues by replenishing cards so that there are always at least three on the table for searching. The game ends when one player collects a specified number of cards.

Name: Keetoo
Description:
Each player starts the game with 10 tokens, each of which has a different symbol on it. They must be kept face down. Players take turns flipping over one card in the center of the table and each card displays only 8 of the 10 symbols shown on token. Players simultaneously study the card to figure out which two symbols are missing. When a player figures one out, she places their token with the missing symbol face down in front of them. She does the same when she does the same when figure out the second one and shouts "Keetoo!"

Then she must flip her remaining 8 tokens face down while the other players keep searching for the missing symbols. When she is done flipping tokens face down, she yells, "Stop!"  AT this point, she reveals her tokens showing symbols she believes are missing from the card and all players inspect them. If she is correct, she receives two points. If one or both are wrong, she receives nothing and all other other players receive one point for each correct token they have identified.

The winner is the first player to receive a designated number of points dependent on the number of players.

Name: Fipolino
Description:
Fipolino is a game of logic, concentration, and speed for children.

The game comes with three figurines--a blue knight, a yellow princess, and a red dragon--and two pairs of dice. One pair of dice depicts a sword, a crown, and fire--each one corresponding to one of the characters. The other pair shows colors: blue, yellow, and red--again, each one corresponding to one of the characters. The game also has 20 counters.

Players roll either pair of dice. If they roll the dice with pictures and each dice shows a different character, players grab for the third character not shown on the dice. Whoever grabs the character first gets one counter. If the dice match and show the same character, players grab for that figurine and the first to get it takes a counter. Play works the same way if players roll the dice with colors on them.

The first player to get five counters wins! 
Putting hands, eyes and minds together to choose which wooden figurine to grab according to the colors and images from the roll of the dice.

Simple, intuitive and fun – Fipolino!

Name: Spring
Description:
Spring is a cooperative game where players work together to overgrow a city. The Biological control unit is destroying any unauthorised biological growth in the city, all of our natural spaces have been destroyed. We must band together and overgrow the city.

Play cards to grow plants in your district, trade cards with your friends and purchase actions needed to accelerate growth. All while the BCU moves around the city removing our plants and gathering evidence to shut down our greenhouses.

—description from the designer

Name: Fredagsslik
Description:
Spice up your family's treat-time with a little healthy competition by fighting for the candy rather than giving it out to each person.

Take turns rolling the dice, moving along the board and performing various actions, like stealing candy from opponents, exchange candy bowls or give a piece of candy to an opponent.

Be careful not to get a stomach ache, for then you have to wait one round.

The player who reaches the goal area first wins the game and all the other players have to give them four pieces of candy as a prize.

Name: Fruit Punch
Description:
Fruit Punch is a fruit-themed game where players have to collect Fruit cards to win the game. The deck contains 62 cards, which consist of Fruit and Animal cards.

In the beginning, each player is given 5 Fruit cards. The players take turns drawing card(s) from the draw pile until someone draws Mad Monkey. When that happens, the player is knocked out. However, the knocked-out player can still take action and gather points.

During their turn, players may either play a fruit card as an Action card or place it in their Field as a Point card. To end the turn, the player must draw at least 1 card from the pile. If the drawn card is an Animal, the player must end the turn and get the penalty written on the card. The game continues clockwise until only 1 player left, and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Pummelomis Knusperkekse
Description:
Small push-your-luck game, where players try to get the most grandmother-baked cookies by turning around coasters and rolling dice.

On their turn, players take a stack of coasters, turn them around and get a number of cookies depending on the front side of the coaster or in one case lose all their cookies gathered this round. A player may stop their turn before flipping another coaster to secure all their cookies. The first player with 54 cookies ends the game and the player with the most cookies wins.

Name: 1,2,3: kennst du uns?
Description:
1,2,3 – kennst du uns? is a game published in the DDR (East Germany before the wall came down).

A game for younger children. Pack consists of 11 groups of three. Each group has three cards and they are marked with dots, a 1, a 2 and a 3.

3 Game suggestions in the rules.

1. The cards are shuffled and dealt evenly. The beginning child looks for an animal with a one-dot from his cards, says its name and places the card face up. Who has the same animal with two dots, must place that card, the player with the third matching card (three dots) also places and may then call the next animal with a one-dot and place it, etc. The winner is whoever runs out of cards first.
 2. The shuffled cards remain in a pile with their backs up and are picked up individually in turn. Everyone who gets a card with a 1 dot, puts it down after calling it out. Then the cards with two dots  may also be laid out, whoever has the third matching card may take the trio. The winner is whoever has the most cards last. If you make a mistake, you have to moan or cackle etc. depending on the animal with which you did something wrong.
 3. The game can also be played like a Schwarzer Peter", the black dog is then Peter, the other two dogs are removed from the game beforehand.

Each game in the order above uses slightly more complex rules.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Gloomspite Gitz
Description:
The Bad Moon is rising on the Mortal Realms – and the grots are marching to war. This battletome allows you to field an army of Gloomspite Gitz – a coalition of Moonclan Grots, Spiderfang Grots, troggoths and gargants united by a love hallucinogenic fungus and heinous violence. Inside this book, you'll find…


     An in-depth look at the origins, lore and great battles of the Gloomspite Gitz
     A showcase of stunningly painted miniatures – plus tips for painting your own
     Powerful new faction abilities that let you represent the madcap tactics of the Gloomspite Gitz on your tabletop
     Warscrolls and points profiles that let you build any kind of army you want – teeming hordes of grots, scuttling Spider Riders, brutish tribes of troggoths or a mix of the three
     And more!


If you're looking to spread destruction (or just take on the tabletop with hordes of squigs), Battletome: Gloomspite Gitz is your essential guide.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Lumineth Realm-Lords
Description:
Lumineth are masters of magic. Through their immeasurable skill, they will save the Mortal Realms from disaster – no matter the cost. Only the Lumineth would be arrogant enough to claim the title of Realm-lords, yet such is the close bond they have forged with Hysh that they have earned that right. Their immaculate shining companies fight as one, whilst the devout warriors of their aelementiri temples call upon the war spirits of the elements to lend them supernatural powers and even battle alongside them.

Master a new generation of aelves with Battletome: Lumineth Realm-lords – your guide to the light-wielding, elemental-mastering inhabitants of Hysh. Whether you're a veteran of the world-that-was looking for the spiritual successors to your High Elves of yore or a new player looking for a rewarding, tactical and powerful army, this book is your complete guide. Discover the history of the Lumineth Realm-lords with rich lore and beautiful art, get inspired for your own personal hobby with a showcase of stunning miniatures and painting tips, and field an army with warscrolls, allegiance abilities, spell lores and more.

This 90 page hardback book contains:


     Allegiance abilities for Lumineth, including a variety of battle traits
     2 spell lores
     2 battleplans that allow you to fight thrilling narrative battles that suit the Lumineth Realm-lords ways of war
     Rules for creating a Lumineth warband for Path to Glory, including Champion and Followers Rewards Tables
     4 warscroll battalions
     13 warscrolls, and 3 endless spell warscrolls
     Pitched battle profiles for all units and endless spells featured in this battletome


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Seraphon
Description:
Seraphon strive to enact the Great Plan of the Old Ones, their ancient and mysterious creators. They are utterly dedicated to the destruction of Chaos, and will show no mercy to any who stand in their way. Commanded by the slann, cohorts of brutal saurus are bolstered by swift skinks and towering reptilian behemoths. Those who stand before them soon find themselves met by the unfeeling wrath of the cosmos.

In Battletome: Seraphon, the might of the heavens is yours to command! This tome of rules, art and lore is your complete guide to these avenging lizardmen and their monstrous armies. Discover why the Seraphon came to the Mortal Realms, how their society works, from the celestial beings known as the Starborne to the savage reptilian Coalesced. Learn their lore, get inspired and field an army for yourself with a suite of powerful and thematic rules, including allegiance abilities, spell lores, artefacts and more.

Maybe you'll field a magically charged force of Starborne Seraphon, teleporting around the battlefield, blitzing enemies with spells and summoning reinforcements from the temple-ships to battle. Or perhaps you’ll field a hardened force of Coalesced, tearing the enemy apart in close combat with savage fury. Or you might just field loads of Stegadons and call it a day. It’s up to you! To help you with your army, this book also contains collecting tips, with example armies, stunningly painted miniatures, painting advice and Path to Glory rules.

This 104 page hardback book contains:

     The history and origins of the Seraphon – from their discovery in the aetheric void by Dracothion to their conquest and terraforming of the Mortal Realms
     Lore and art that brings the world of the Seraphon to life
     Tips for collecting Seraphon, and rules that allow you to fight battles with them on the tabletop
     Allegiance abilities that bestow a wide selection of battle traits, command traits, artefacts of power and unique spell lores upon your army
     A battleplan representing a sudden intervention from above by the Seraphon
     Rules themed around the four most famed Seraphon Constellations – sub-factions with their own additional special rules


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Idoneth Deepkin
Description:
From out of blackness they come, emerging from the depths of the realms’ seas upon a surging tide of magic. These merciless raiders do not seek merely to slaughter or enslave, however, for they are the Idoneth Deepkin – they have come to take their victims’ very souls. They bring with them the magic of their kingdoms, an ethersea of roiling currents and crushing pressures. In their passing, the Idoneth leave ruin, death and sleepers that will never awaken – victims whose souls have been stolen. Retreating beneath the waves, the Idoneth return to the utter isolation of the depths.

In the 136-page hardback Battletome: Idoneth Deepkin, you’ll find:


     A Strange Genesis: the origins of the Idoneth Deepkin, the aelven raiders who lurk in the deepest oceans, avoiding the predations of Slaanesh and the dismal fate that hangs over their entire race;
     The Great Emptiness: the story of the manner in which Idoneth Deepkin scrabble for survival – their offspring mostly born soulless, they raid above land to steal souls and keep themselves from extinction;
     The Deep Places: the secluded strongholds amongst the fathomless depths which the Idoneth Deepkin call home, and the expansion of their submerged cities;
     The Idoneth Deepkin At War: how this race fights, and the signs that their armies are about to rise, along with descriptions of their bond-beasts;
     Underwater Empires: a timeline of significant events and battles in their history, from the Age of Myth to the Age of Sigmar – and the stirring of Slaanesh;
     Descriptions of the Idoneth Enclaves, with an overview of their caste system and in-depth details of their military structure;
     A guide to the Whirlways, realmgate routes from which the Idoneth Deepkin launch their raids;
     Explanation and background of each character and unit available to an Idoneth Deepkin army;
     A showcase of beautifully-painted Citadel miniatures, with an example army and comprehensive painting advice from the experts, including stage by stage examples of painting skin, blades, sea detritus and creatures, scales, and helmet crests. Along with this are colour schemes and guides to painting 6 named Enclaves: Ionrach, Dhom-Hain, Fuethán, Mor’phann, Nautilar, and Briomdar.


Rules

All the rules you need in order to get your Idoneth Deepkin army ready for the gaming table are here:


     14 Warscrolls, covering every miniature in the Idoneth Deepkin faction, including a Warscroll for the Gloomtide Shipwreck scenery piece;
     Allegiance Abilities representing the Idoneth Deepkin’s methods of war – including Command Traits, a Tides of Death table which introduces new abilities in each round, and 4 different types of Artefacts of Power;
     Lore of the Deeps: a selection of spells usable by Idoneth Deepkin wizards;
     Abilities, Warscroll Battalion rules, magic and Command Traits for the following 6 Enclaves: Ionrach, Dhom-Hain, Fuethán, Mor’phann, Nautilar, and Briomdar;
     3 Battleplans , including objectives for both sides, deployment map, special rules and victory conditions;
     Idoneth Deepkin tactics: advice on advanced tactics that suit this army’s play style;
     Rules for creating an Idoneth Deepkin warband to use in a Path to Glory campaign, including a Followers Rewards Table, a Champion Rewards Table and a Path to Glory Battleplan;
     6 Warscroll Battalions conferring advantages for fielding certain combinations of models;
     Pitched Battle Profiles for all units featured in this Battletome, including unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles.


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Sons of Behemat
Description:
The titanic Sons of Behemat have might enough to throttle dragons, barge down castle walls and tear elder oaks from the ground. When they attack as a tribe they become unstoppable, stamping the enemy’s infantry flat and pummelling rival monsters to death. Any who oppose their rule are battered with hurled boulders before the gargants charge in, each towering hulk roaring in savage triumph as he seizes victory through brute force and ignorance

Battletome: Sons of Behemat is your guide to Warhammer Age of Sigmar's biggest army – a force like no other where GARGANTS are your troops and EVEN BIGGER GARGANTS lead them to battle! In this tome of knowledge, you'll discover the hidden history of Gargants in the Mortal Realms, from their origins with the godbeast Behemat to their work as mercenaries with the Grand Alliances. Stunning art brings the world of the Sons of Behemat to life, helping to inspire your own collection! When you're ready to field an army of your own, stunning miniatures photography, conversion guides and painting tips are included to help you out. Meanwhile rules for a variety of gargant tribes let you customise your army, or even include a Mega-Gargant in any force, whether you owe your allegiance to Death, Destruction, Chaos or Order!

This 80-page hardback battletome contains:

     A history of the Sons of Behemat, including the epic deeds of their forefather, the godbeast Behemat
     Painting guidance on skin tones and colour schemes within the gargant race
     Allegiance abilities for the Sons of Behemat, including additional rules for Stomper Tribes, Taker Tribes and Breaker Tribes
     Includes rules of Mega-Gargant Mercenaries – enabling any Warhammer Age of Sigmar player to use Mega-Gargants in their armies
     Warscrolls and Pitched Battle Profiles for every miniature in the Sons of Behemat range


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Ogor Mawtribes
Description:
Ogors are rotund brutes entirely obsessed with eating and fighting. They rampage across the Mortal Realms on an endless, cyclical Mawpath, devouring everything they set their piggish eyes upon. Enemies are blasted apart by blackpowder cannons, gored by long-tusked beasts of the frozen wastes and trampled by a sweaty, bellowing mass of flesh. Only the lucky ones are dead before the ogors start to eat them.

Inside this 120-page book you'll find overview of the Ogor Mawtribes and their two main cultures, which are united by their worship of Gorkamorka. A huge selection of rules gives you countless ways to play with your Ogor collection. Allegiance abilities bolster dedicated forces of Ogor Mawtribes, while rules for several legendary tribes allow you to tailor your army to suit your play style. Warscroll battalions reward you for fielding specific combinations of models, while Path to Glory warband creation rules and bespoke Ogor missions are perfect for your first few games. This battletome is also a great resource for collectors, featuring tips for painting details like rusted blades and ice weapons, as well as a showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures to inspire your own collection.

This battletome contains:


     Lore and art that explores the history of the Ogor Mawtribes, and how they battle today
     A showcase of beautifully painted miniatures
     Painting advice including examples of different skin, rusted blades, gut-plates, clothes, tattoos, ice weapons, banner symbols, fur and more
     Allegiance abilities for Ogor Mawtribes, including a table of battle traits, four command trait tables, four artefacts of power tables, the Lore of Gutmagic and Lore of the Sun-Eater spell tables, an Everwinter Prayers table, and two mount traits tables
     10 warscroll battalions for fielding different combinations of models
     22 unit warscrolls and a scenery warscroll for the Great Mawpot
     Pitched battle profiles for all units featured in this Battletome and the Great Mawpot, including min/max unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles


—description from the publisher

Name: V-Sabotage: Ghost
Description:
Game series formerly titled, 'V-Commandos', but has now been retitled, 'V-Sabotage'.

New game modes, operations, event cards, dice and more... compatible with all V-Commandos games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dans les Cordes: Santa Cross Promo Card
Description:
A promo card for the boxing game "Dans les cordes".
There is French text on the card but the icons make it understandable.
The card has to be mixed with other cards to be played.

Name: Psychopath
Description:
PSYCHOPATH

A Killer Card Game for 1 to 4 Campers and One Psycho!

Psychopath is a ‘One vs. Many’ card game where one player acts as the Psychopath - a deranged killer attempting to hunt down and kill the Camper players using a variety of Actions and Items at his disposal. The Camper players try to survive the Psychopath’s attacks and hope for rescue using the Actions, Items, Allies and Skills available in their deck of cards. If the Psychopath manages to kill all the Campers, he wins the game! However, if at least one Camper survives or manages to become rescued, the Campers win! Psychopath can also be played as a Campaign, with both sides scoring points over a predetermined number of games.

Psychopath is presented with a campy B-Horror Movie flavor splashed with inane commentary and featuring over-the-top, and sometimes gruesome, imagery!

Game Play:

Psychopath is played in rounds. At the start of each round all players secretly select a card from their hand to be played as their starting card and place it face down on the table. When all players have done so, cards are then revealed to show the location each players is at: the Lake, the Cabin, the Shed, or the Woods. Campers unlucky enough to be at the same location as the Psychopath enter into a Struggle with him.

During this Struggle, the Psychopath and Campers take turns playing cards from their hand and using Keep in Play cards they have on the table they have previously put into play. Campers can play Allies, Skills, Items and Actions to bolster their defense, attempt to Escape or become Rescued, and to thwart the attacks made by the Psychopath. The Psychopath will play Items and Actions to cause Wounds to the Campers in order to weaken or kill them. After players in a Struggle have played all the cards they wish, Struggles are resolved with Campers losing cards from their hand of cards equal to the number of Wounds they suffered. If a Camper suffers more Wounds than the cards in their hand, they are killed! The Psychopath suffers his Wounds by discarding that number of cards from the top of his deck of cards. If, at the start of the next draw Phase, the Psychopath has no cards remaining in his deck, the surviving Campers escape and the game is over!

After all Struggles are resolved, if there are two or more Campers at the same location and they are not at the Psychopath's location, they may Collaborate by giving each other Items and Allies, and by strategizing (Campers cannot otherwise discuss strategy during the game). A new round then begins with the Campers each drawing a card from the Camper deck of cards and the Psychopath drawing cards from his deck to fill his hand of cards to its starting limit. Hand management is an important aspect of Psychopath; deciding when to play cards and when to save them in your hand for later use can mean the difference between Survival and Death!

Game Contents:

126 Thick Game Cards (60 for the Psychopath, 66 for the Campers)
    1 Rulebook
    1 Nice Shiny Box including a 4-Way Plastic Divider for the cards with Extra Space to hold Upcoming  Expansions!

—description from the designers

Name: Dans les Cordes: Abaissement Promo Card
Description:
A promo card released for the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) in 2020 for the boxing game "Dans les cordes".
The French text on the card says: Against a "cross" type attack.
The card has to be mixed with other cards to be played.

Name: Battlespace: SORD Operatives Card Pack Supplement
Description:
An expansion set of 16 cards introducing the private military company known as SORD Inc (Special Operations Research Development). Specializing in asset protection and recovery, SORD’s operatives are recruited from around the world and are highly trained individuals of various military backgrounds.

The enemy cards in this set will push the SORD operatives to the limit when combined with enemy cards from previous releases. Your team will need to equip some of the new gear so they don't fall behind in this new era of tech and combat.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Quarantine King
Description: The goal of Quarantine King is simple- become the Quarantine King by stashing up the most days worth of supplies before The Store (Draw Pile) runs out. This is done by stacking identical pairs of Supplies and looting Supply Stashes from opponents. Pandemonium ensues when attempting to loot Supply Stashes from opponents. Building your own Supply Stashes is smart, but it is strategic to loot your neighbors’ Supply Stashes. Identical Supplies and Wild Cards (Toilet Paper and Hand Sanitizer) give you the opportunity to loot! Additionally, Action Cards can give you an advantage over your opponents and increase your chances of becoming the Quarantine King.

Name: Core Space: First Born – The Gates of Ry'sa
Description:
This expansion adds the ancient Gates of Ry’sa to the game in the form of some new terrain pieces along with some powerful new First Born threats – the Talos and the Cerberosa. It includes everything required to integrate the new miniatures and terrain with the starter set, including dice, equipment tokens, event cards and a mission booklet.

The new narrative campaign in the expansion will see your Traders attempt to secure one of these gates for themselves before passing through it to reach yet more undiscovered treasures in the more distant asteroid bases. New equipment and mining opportunities await amongst the incredible new terrain pieces included in this set. The gates are housed in enormous caverns large enough for all manner of creatures to come through, and the shifting colours in the energy pylons make for an eye-catching centrepiece to your gaming table. New event cards shuffled into the deck will represent the reality-shifting nature of the nearby gate.

There are three Cerberosa included in the set. These vicious beasts are deadly in close-assault and take advantage of the rules for poisoned attacks, further weakening their wounded victims. Cerberosa do not roll the Knowledge Die when they attack, instead coming with their own bespoke die. Its additional effects include crippling strikes that reduce your Skill pegs, frenzied attacks that target multiple opponents, and pure brute strength, adding further poisoned hits to their attacks.

The Gates of Ry’sa includes two Talos. Like the Cerberosa the Talos rolls its own bespoke dice when attacking representing the physical effects of its powerful energy blasts. These include knocking opponents from their feet, instilling panic, and even setting their victims on fire! Talos are also very tough to kill. Getting through their rock-like armour a first time will only make them stumble – you’ll have to hit them again before they recover to permanently power them down.

-description from Kickstarter campaign

Name: Core Space: First Born – Trading Post 5
Description:
This expansion brings the Traders back out of the asteroid temples and introduces a host of new characterful NPCs at the local Trading Post. It includes everything required to integrate the new miniatures and terrain with the starter set, including equipment tokens, event cards and a mission booklet.

The new narrative campaign in the expansion will see your Traders visit the Trading Post hoping for a big score from their recently acquired alien loot. They can peruse the stores, meet with contacts, and even recruit new Traders to their cause. However, the aliens that they so rudely awakened have followed them back… Can they defend the settlement from its attackers trying to reclaim their asteroid home?

The new terrain in the set forms part of Trading Post 5 and is made up of shops and cargo in pre-fab containers. The expansion is populated by new NPCs, including Civilians, a lone Galactic Corps agent, and the Ganger proprietor of the Trading Post. All of these can be used in the new expansion or combined with their respective NPC types from other expansions.

On top of this there are four new playable Traders. These wandering Traders can be hired by any crew, or combined as a crew in their own right!

-description from Kickstarter campaign

Name: Core Space: First Born – Patrol Class Shuttle
Description: This pack contains a new class of Shuttle, different in design and colour to the Shuttle from the original game. It can be purchased by your crews to get in and out of dangerous locations, and also functions as an interactive piece of terrain on the table. It comes complete with a mission booklet to integrate it with the Core Space First Born story.

Name: Core Space: First Born – Fury of the Insane God
Description: This expansion adds the First Born’s so-called True God to the game, flanked by its hulking Guardians. It includes everything required to integrate the new miniatures with the starter set, including equipment tokens, event cards and a mission booklet.

Name: Core Space: First Born – In The Line of Fire
Description: This expansion focuses on the non-combatants that enter this new warzone alongside your Traders. The New Crew actively get themselves in the line of fire for the sake of a good story, while the Prospectors are gemologists and miners hoping to extract the new and valuable minerals from the catacomb walls. Both will often hire Traders as security when entering dangerous environments. The expansion includes everything required to integrate the new miniatures with the starter set, including equipment tokens, event cards and a mission booklet.

Name: Core Space: First Born – First Born Support
Description: This pack contains an additional set of First Born miniatures, as well as the Event cards required to expand your games with additional enemies.

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Vendetta: Melissa and Kevin Promo Card
Description:
A Kickstarter promo Victim card for Vampire: The Masquerade - Vendetta featuring the two hosts of Tantrum House to be shuffled into the main Victim deck.

1 Influence, 1 Blood per turn.
When drained, provides 3 blood.
No special ability.

Name: Knitting: The Card Game – Booster Pack #1
Description:
The Booster Pack no. 1 for 'Knitting: the Card Game' is a deck of 70 cards that can be mixed into the base game that gives new actions, new patterns and new yarn cards to choose from.
 An additional 4 Cast-on cards and 'blocking mat' are included because when the 64 new cards mixed in, gameplay can support up to five players.

Card breakdown:
38 Yarn Store Cards
16 Pattern Cards
8 Community Cards
2 cards that become a 'Finished Object' Blocking Mat in purple    supports a 5th player
4 New Cast-On Cards in purple supports a 5th player
2 instruction cards with a new rule modification allowing more Community Cards to be played

-description from designer

Name: Marching Band(-imals)
Description:
Marching Band(-imals) is a tabletop, marching band-themed card game - but all the band members are animals!  You are a band director, build a band for the upcoming marching band (football) season.  Compete against up to 6 other opponents to build your band the fastest.  Play bonus cards to make your band-building more efficient.  Play penalty cards to limit the success of your opponents.  Your band is complete when you have 5 players and corresponding pieces of equipment while avoiding duplication.  Once your band is complete, grab a Drum Major card and hold onto it for one full round to win!

-description from publisher

Name: Electric Empires
Description:
A Game of Power and Intrigue in the Gilded Age

The war of the currents is raging. Thomas Edison’s direct current is safe, cheap and simple, but weak. Nikola Tesla’s alternating current is powerful, but complicated and occasionally deadly. Which technology will power New York City and then the world?

As the leader of a fledgling electric company you must hire staff, build generators and power lines, win bids, complete projects…and sabotage the competition. Build your Electric Empire and power the gilded age.

Electric Empires is an engine-building, worker placement game set in the gilded age of New York City. A unique shared reputation mechanism balances semi-cooperative strategy with cut-throat competition. Asymmetric gameplay means different power currents require different strategies and tactics providing great replayability.

Electric Empires is played over the course of 10 years (rounds) each consisting of four quarters (turns). Each turn a player may take two actions: initiating a bid on a project, hiring or assigning workers, building generators, seeking financing or playing action cards.

Each year (round) progress must be made on active projects, debt must be retired or interest paid and maintenance must be performed on in-play power generators.

Completing projects is the main way to gain victory points. Each project represents providing power to a historic location in glided age New York City. Project contracts are acquired through bidding against competing players in terms of how much money you want to complete the project, how long it will take you and the current reputation of your electrical current AC or DC.

In addition to the workers necessary to complete a project you must build generators to supply sufficient power. These generators must be either located adjacent to the project on the gameboard or connected by powerlines which you can also build. Power can be leased either from one of two public utilities or from a competing player using the same current. Projects can be lost due to a lack of progress or malfunctions. Players can sabotage competitors' projects and potentially take them over and gain the associated victory points.

Careful planning of project bidding and generator placement is necessary to build an engine that will produce enough revenue to fund your commitments and enough energy to power projects once they are complete. If power to a completed project is disrupted, victory points from that project are not counted until power is restored.

Each year (round) a new "Annual Forecast" card is drawn which sets unique conditions for all players for the duration of the year (round).

Players may choose either Thomas Edison's preferred current, Direct Current (CD) or Nikola Tesla's Alternating Current (AC). Each has its own advantages and disadvantages leading to asymmetrical gameplay. Both currents (AC and DC) also have an associated reputation or public perception shared by all players using that current. A good reputation makes winning bids and getting financing easier. A negative reputation makes succeeding more difficult.

At the end of year (round) ten, the player with the most victory points is declared the winner.

-description from designer

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Khagra's Ravagers
Description:
Khagra the Usurper and her band of Slaves to Darkness see Direchasm as the site of the culmination of their personal path to glory; a final proving ground where they will earn the attention of the Dark Gods. They mean to turn the mountain to the service of Chaos by desecrating its every chamber through dark sorcery and brutal sacrifice. It was Khagra’s sister Zarshia who led the warband into Beastgrave, but they soon became trapped in a gnashing chamber. Khagra wedged her shield between the cavern floor and the encroaching ceiling before carving a way out of the rocky gullet, and since then, the brutal warriors Cragan and Razek have turned to Khagra for direction. Zarshia has not abandoned her own ambitions, however, and is poised to overturn her upstart sibling when the opportunity arises.

Claim the living mountain in the name of the Dark Gods with Khagra's Ravagers. They're tough, strong, and wield sorcerous power, giving you multiple ways to desecrate Direchasm. Speaking of which, their new Desecration mechanic can prevent opposing warbands from claiming objectives. This set also includes a number of Universal cards that can be used by any warband in Warhammer Underworlds and you can even add Khagra's Ravagers to your Slaves to Darkness force in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This set contains:
- 4x push fit Khagra's Ravagers miniatures – no glue required to assemble
- 4x fighter cards, representing each warrior in your games – Khagra the Usurper, Zarshia Bittersoul, Razek Godblessed, and Dour Cragan
- A further 62 playable cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm, including:
- 12x Khagra's Ravagers Objective cards
- 10x Khagra's Ravagers Upgrade cards
- 10x Khagra's Ravagers Ploy cards
- 10x Universal Objective cards, usable by any warband
- 10x Universal Upgrade cards, usable by any warband
- 8x Universal Gambit cards, usable by any warband
- 2x Universal Gambit Spell cards, usable by any warband with a wizard
- 1x Desecration Tokens rules card

Name: Wanna Hocka Lugie
Description:
Follow in the footsteps of the ancient Hawaiians in Wanna Hocka Lugie, the trading game inspired by the legend of Ka'ao. Players head to the Hawaiian marketplace in a race to fill their baskets. Each player controls two pawns - one that can trade goods and one that can steal goods from the baskets of other players. There's a delicate balance as players map out their acquisition strategy - trade or steal - and all the while avoiding thievery themselves! Players begin with a basket containing three items. By landing one's trading pawn (Tally Trader) on various items, a player can trade up for more valuable goods, stepping up the value of the items in his basket. Maneuvering one's stealing pawn (Shifty Shorty) onto the same space as an opponent's trader gives him the opportunity to shortcut the whole system and pick up valuable goods the "easy" way. Trade and steal. Steal and trade. Twists, turns, and a little bit of luck keep it close until the end. Who will return triumphantly from the market as the Big Kahuna?

Contents include: Game Board, 4 Trading Pawns, 4 Stealing Pawns, 2 Dice, 4 Trading Basket Placards, 54 Item Cards.

Name: Avatar: The Last Airbender Uncle Iroh's Dream
Description:
In Uncle Iroh's Dream, follow the wise firebender's sage advice and craft your own cartoon stories using characters, locations, events, animals and special item cards! Save your favorite written stories as mementos and use the White Lotus tile, Avatar state and Appa tokens to make your story more unique! Each game is designed for 3 to 10 players, and runs for 15 to 30 minutes.

Players take turns playing cards as story elements to Uncle Iroh's dream, all while the sand time trickles down, voting on the elements that will be included as the story moves forward.

The rules also contain variant game rules, including:
- King Bumi's "Mad Genius" Mode
- Tea From the Spirit World
- Uncle Iroh and Zuko Variant
- In My Opinion Variant
Families: TV Shows: Avatar The Last Airbender/Legend of Korra

Name: Phrase Daze
Description: Divide into teams/players and place the deck of 50 cards facedown in the middle. The team going first turns over a card and tries to guess the well-known phrase that the image represents. The team/player has three guesses. One of the opposing teams/players can check if they guess the correct interpretation (answer).  If the active team guesses the correct answer, they get a point. If they don’t guess the correct answer within three guesses, they don’t get a point.  Play then passes to the next team/player.  The first player or team to score fifteen points wins.

Name: Avatar: The Last Airbender Oh, My Cabbages!
Description:
Take Aang, Katara, Zuko and even the cabbage merchant around the world of Avatar: The Last Airbender while starting new cabbage stands, mastering the elements, looting coins from your opponents and sending security platypus bears to shut down the competition. Play as your favorite character and build your very own cabbage empire. Everyone else will be yelling, "Oh, my cabbages!"

Each round players take turns placing their merchant at different locations and performing corresponding actions: discovering locations, building cabbage stands, saving coins in the starting stand, looting other player's stands, hiring employees, hiring benders, hiring security platypus bears to attack other stands, visiting Uncle Iroh's tea shop to defend their stands, drawing messenger hawk cards, drawing defense cards, and claiming the 1st player token for next round.

Looting and attacking are resolved as they occur, and players may use benders to defend, and even counter to set up a bender duel. At the end of the round, players collect available income from their owned stands and begin the next round. In rounds 7-12, players are granted a 2nd merchant, taking turns in a "snake draft" order, and starting stand incomes increase.

At the end of the 12th round players count up their unspent coins plus hired employees (+2 coins), damage tokens (-2 coins), benders (+3 coins) and owned stands (+10 coins). The player with the most coins wins.
Families: TV Shows: Avatar The Last Airbender/Legend of Korra

Name: Improper Nouns
Description:
SUMMARY

What's in a name? The choice is yours!

Improper Nouns is a card-based party game for generally fun humans and proper word nerds.

Discover more about your friends, share some laughs, and reveal new inside jokes.  With more than 100,000 potential combinations, it's a new game every time. You’ll never see words the same way!

BASIC GAMEPLAY

1) The judge draws an Adjective card and a Noun card and puts them together. Ex. Lucky Stranger

2) Choose a Description card from your hand that best "fits" the combination. You can be literal, creative, or crazy!

3) The judge picks a winner from all players entries.

CURVEBALLS

Swap 1 --- Swap 3 --- Split

These cards might show up when the Judge draws a Noun card. They’re hidden in the Noun deck and mix up the gameplay!

BONUS CARDS

Each round, check to see if the Adjective + Noun pair is notable in any of these ways. If it is, the winner earns a Bonus, too! (Note, if someone else wins a future hand, they TAKE your bonus card!)

RHYME TIME -- ADJ. + N. RHYME
LETTER LOVE -- ADJ. + N. START WITH THE SAME LETTER
SAME SAME BUT DIFFERENT -- ADJ. + N. SHARE THE SAME ROOT WORD
AN ACTUAL THING -- ADJ. + N. FORM A "REAL" PROPER NOUN

GOAL

Win the game by winning 7 rounds and collecting the Adjective and Noun cards. Note: Bonus cards count the same as winning a round!

—description from the designer

Name: Coronavirus le jeu
Description:
The game begins at the start of the coronavirus epidemic, when a few people are starting to feel the first symptoms...

When the game starts, only some players are infected, but after a few handshakes, hugs and other dinners with friends, the number of cases is likely to increase rapidly!

There are two ways you can win: 

     be the last to survive the outbreak or 
     the first to be immune. 


A player is immune if he does not suffer any contamination for 3 full turns after healing. 
A player dies if their viral load exceeds 5.

– translated description from the publisher

Name: Where in the World?
Description: Place the deck of 50 cards facedown in the middle. One player begins as the guessers. Another players draws a card from the pile and gives clues. There are three clues on each card.  The first is the hardest level and is worth 3 points. The second is medium difficulty level and is worth 2 points. The last is the easiest level and is worth 1 point. The questions are asked in order and the guesser and can try to guess the location after each clue. If the guesser guesses correctly, they score points according to the number of clues needed (1=3, 2=2, 3=1). If the location is not guessed, the player does not score points. The next player then becomes the guesser and a new card is drawn. The first player to score 15 points wins.

Name: Autocat
Description:
Players are the mayor CATs in the great Three-kingdoms era. Striving to recruit their best general cats to win the battles in three rounds.

Each player has five cards in hand. They may discard any number of cards, and draw from the deck up to 5 cards including their hands. During the battle, the players show their hands 
simultaneously and count the icons on their cards to earn the bonuses from the country codes and the types of the arms. The battle starts from the player with more shoes icons. The players attack each other until the HP of a player reaches Zero. The survived player wins the battle and earn the fishes.

The game continues three battles. The player with the most fishes wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Fish! Dash! Cash!
Description:
This game "Fish! Dash! Cash!" Starts playing games as players become stray cats and gather fish. Sometimes the fish may be snatched and targeted by other cats. Of course, myself may sneak fish from other cats and run away. The ultimate goal is to convert the fish to "cash". You can eat fish, but you can not keep it as food for a long time. But if you can afford it, you can buy it whenever you like, "cat can" or "crispy." Huh! What? Do cats be interested in money? The proverbs are already old like "cats small-size". Even now even cats are doing business ... ....

Each player is dealt 5 cards from the deck. One card is put into the "field" from the first player, and each trick is processed.

Cards are color-coded  "blue" and "red" and three types of "role". And cards has a number from 0 to 9.

The card issued by the first player becomes "the lead card", and only the cards that match the color are effectively processed. Cards resolution processes "roles" in descending order of numbers.

These cards are three types of "roles". "Fish", "Cat", and "Money". If you put out "Fish", put it in your "Feeding Area", and if it is "Money", put it in your "Feeding Area". To cash. A "cat" can steal a "fish" from the "feeding ground" to its own "feeding ground" or block another player's "cat" who has come to its "feeding ground". "Cashed fish" cannot be taken by "cats".

When the deck runs out and all the cards are put out, the person with the most "cashed" money in hand wins.

-description from designer

Name: Dice Dodgems
Description:
Dice Dodgems is a 30 minute strategy game of dodging and bumping for 2-4 players, designed by City Square Studios.

In Dice Dodgems, players control miniature dodgems as they dodge and bump around the arena. The goal of the game is to be the last dodgem standing. The winner is the last player with dice.

While the game's rules are easy to understand for newcomers, the bouncing mechanics and ability to see and predict other dodgems moves make for a deeper strategic experience, with great replay-ability. A chess-like battle can occur when two or more strategic players bounce around the arena.

—description from the designer

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Akhorne the Squirrel Star Player Promo Card
Description: This is a promo card for Akhrone the Squirrel that was contained in White Dwarf #458 (November 2020). This contains all the rules for using the Akhrone star player in your games of Blood Bowl. The official model comes in the Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Treeman kit.

Name: 7 Summits: Launch Promos
Description:
Equipment is crucial to summiting the mountains. Pre-ordered copies of 7 Summits come with this pack of three additional equipment cards.

—description from the designer
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Senator Senator
Description:
Ave senator, times are tough within the republic. Barbarians harass Rome from without and corruption seeps from within. You fellow senators are scheming to claim the seat of Emperor for themselves by amassing their influence, might, and wealth. It is up to you, senator, to protect Rome from her foes; both barbarians and corrupt politicians. Either the light and majesty of your Roman Republic will prevail... or someone else will win. Collect Influence, Might, or Wealth cards to challenge the senate and defeat your fellow senators. Play your action cards to advance your political position and elect decrees that work in your favour. But beware for Rome has many enemies. You will have to work together with your fellow senators to protected Rome from Crises and Invasions all while plotting to stab them in the back.

ENTERTAINING FUN: This is a strategic board game for up to eight players that will provide hours of play for family and friends.
GREAT GAMEPLAY: Take on the role of a member of the senate and strive to become Emperor of Rome using your Influence, Might, and Wealth.
162 CARDS: Collect and play Influence, Might, and Wealth action cards to steer the game in your favour. There are many different cards to use against your fellow senators. On the other hand, you may need to work together to overcome crises and invasions.
DEVISE GRAND STRATEGIES: Outsmart and outwit your opponents through clever plans and devious thinking. Bide your time, strengthen your hand, and lure your opponents into your trap to snatch victory from their grasp.
GREAT REPLAY VALUE: The more you play, the better you'll know the cards and the more plans you can create. Enact laws that change the base rules of the game so that every round you play is different.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alias: lisäkorttisarja
Description:
One of the early expansions to Alias - it still carries the Nelospelit logo of the early 1990's.

300 new cards with 8 words each, for a total of 2400 new words to explain.

Name: Ragnarok: Dawn of the Heavens' Massacre CCG – Witness A Divine Comedy
Description:
The Witness A Divine Comedy expansion is when the hero Dreania Reeve hero and her accompanying cards was introduced to the game. 
The expansion also introduced powerful enchantments,spells and card stealing skills.

Name: Pipeline: Emerging Markets
Description: The success of your company is opening up new markets full of opportunities! With your expertise and logistical innovations over the last 3 years, the refinement requirements of this new era are even more demanding. With the emergence of new markets, new technologies and innovations have become available for your business to utilize. Additionally, these emerging markets have brought about new ways of evaluating your business. Will you take advantage of the new ways to exploit the markets or will your business fall to ruin in this everchanging world?

Name: The Heart of Cthulhu
Description:
The Heart of Cthulhu is a cutthroat card game consisting of three decks and more than 300 cards. This adventure game combines strategy and luck with aspects of RPG. This combination, the game’s unique lore and stunning visuals produce a new adventure every time the game is played.

The game consists of 3 Decks of cards, 110 cards each. The Peril, Pillage and Discovery Decks are shuffled and placed in separate stacks with the Pillage Deck in the middle. Two discovery cards are revealed and placed face up next to the Discovery Deck.
    
Shuffle the vessel cards and deal one to each captain face down. Captains then reveal their vessels. Take notice of the vessels’ unique strengths. Each captain starts the game with three integrity chips and three pillage cards. Roll to see who goes first.

Players take turns gathering supplies from the pillage deck and paying to reveal discovery cards. The discovery deck contains New Worlds. In order to gain these New Worlds, Captains must defeat perils from the peril deck.

The first player to gain 3 New Worlds wins the game!

—description the designer

Name: Warhammer: Annual 2004
Description:
Warhammer 2004 Annual is a compilation of Warhammer articles, combined with revised or previously unpublished material.  Here you will find rules for all the latest releases, plus gaming articles and additional gaming material.

This includes new Army Lists for : the Cult of Ulric, Kislev Allies, Wood Elves, Empire Steam Tank and Dogs of War.

It also has profiles for Special Characters such as: Boris Todbringer of Middenheim, Eltharion, Shadowblade, Crom the Conquerer, Valten - The Champion of Sigmar, and Tzarina Katarin the Ice Queen.

Finally is has a complete list of errata.

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – BPRD Archives
Description:
This expansion for Hellboy: The Board Game, allows you to build your own exciting case files so that no two adventures are ever the same!

Contains:

2 x pre-assembled plastic werewolves
    2 x pre-assembled plastic wolves
    2 x pre-assembled plastic witches
    2 x pre-assembled plastic killer birds
    2 x pre-assembled plastic harpies
    2 x pre-assembled plastic bat swarms
    CASE FILE CONSTRUCTOR CARDS
    1 Rules card
    6 Environment cards + 1 title card
    3 Investigation cards + 1 title card
    3 Threat cards + 1 title card
    3 Objective cards + 1 title card
    6 Twist cards + 1 title card
    3 Showdown cards + 1 title card
    1 Confrontation card + 1 title cards
    5 Enemy Cards
    10 Deck of Doom cards
    3 Unexpected Threat cards

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Meeples-at-Arms Promo Card
Description:
Originally available for backers of the Man VS Meeple Kickstarter 2020.

This card is an infantry unit which will melee attack with 1 red die and defend with 1 red die. It can also be used to charge (move 1 space and attack the same turn). They have the skill Retaliation.

A unit with the retaliation skill can apply a kill or disrupt result from their defence roll to any melee attacking unit. The player must roll the dice of the retaliating unit separately 
to distinguish them from other units. The attack and the retaliation are considered to be simultaneous.

The player suffering the retaliation cannot use shield results from their attack roll to cancel retaliation results.
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: Itékiya
Description:
In Itékiya the players act at the same time, using one of the options available on the cards shown, throughout twelve turns they will try to perform combos to be able to complete the missions and maximize their scores. It is a game designed so that novice players can play alongside more experienced players,  which can take unique challenges that will make a complex gameplay.

—description from the designer

Name: Trailblazer
Description:
In Trailblazer each player creates a 6x6 grid and then attempts to reconstruct their opponent's grid.

A grid is created by entering a number from 1-25 in any space and then entering the next higher number in an adjacent space, and so on, until most or all of the spaces are filled; some spaces can be filled with an "X" instead of a number, but these cannot be adjacent to each other or the first or last spaces of the "trail."

After the grids are created players take turns asking each other for the contents of one space. When a player thinks they can recreate their opponent's grid they do so and win if they are correct.

Name: Super Fantasy Brawl: Circle of Blood
Description:
Add to the roster of your Champions with the Circle of Blood! This expansion adds Korvash, Mariusz, and Rath to your Champions. Let’s take a look at them! When Korvash grasped the hilt of the old blade he found in the tomb, his mind was consumed with dark visions; promises of a world on fire, and of his enemies kneeling before him. Filled with a desire to make his dreams a reality, he submitted to the presence within the sword, becoming its willing servant. Korvash would go on to take over his tribe, and lead them in a bloody conquest of the Hillsglade. Korvash’s confidence and power grew with every victory. But the visions never stopped, and Scornblade’s hunger was never sated.

The life of Mariusz Demont has never been easy, despite being born into nobility. A member of the Moontouched, Mariusz showed no sign of lycanthropy, relegating him to a life of service to
his older, more blessed brothers. Treated with contempt throughout his life, it was during an attack that left his father Angren dead that Mariusz’s gift revealed itself. Exploding into a rage-filled beast, he slaughtered friend and foe alike, his years of torment blinding him to his bloodlust. Despised by his own people as a traitor, Mariusz counted none his ally as he continued his cursed existence.

As Kilgore’s armies grew, so too did the strength of his enemies. Many enemies were crushed on the battlefield, but others needed a subtler touch. These enemies attract the attention of Rath, Kilgore’s most trusted and lethal assassin. A subterran of incredible agility and ferocity, he is the deadliest weapon in Kilgore’s arsenal, able to slip quietly into any location, and execute his target. Rath served Kilgore loyally for many years, reveling in the chaos and destruction he wrought.

Name: Super Fantasy Brawl: Art of War
Description:
Add to the roster of your Super Fantasy Brawl Champions with the Art of War! This expansion adds Sulka, Ko'lel, and Ahket to your Champions. Let’s take a look at them! Subtle and deceptive, Sulka manipulated her people into a civil war that consumed them, profiting herself with their suffering. Her dark magics and powers over the mind left both sides of the war as putty in her scaled hands, and soon Sulka was poised to control what little remained. Beneath her rule, her people turned to foul, long forbidden magics, and conquered Khemara in short order. Her empire would rule for hundreds of years, and it would be long past Sulka’s time that her people would learn that their success was built on the machinations of evil and greed.

Akhet, the Skylord of Khemara, ruled the nation of Khemara until its dying days. A proud and noble King, Akhet commanded the skies as the bravest warrior his people had ever known, ruling the largest dynasty in the history of Fabulosa. Akhet led the charge in any battle he was a part of, breaking the enemy with his tireless ferocity. Even when a dark and sorcerous force arose to lead their most hated foe to victory, the Skylord led the charge, determined to cast down this hidden evil and bring light to the darkest hour of his people.

Records of the Darkmoon Occupation of Yunkaya speak of the legendary gnome Kolel, and her fearsome mount To’paque. Armed with her deadly blowpipe, her combination of skill, speed, and tactical knowledge was believed to have saved thousands of her people, despite the destruction of her jungle. Whilst she is regarded as the greatest hero in Yunkayan history, to the Moontouched she is the boogeyman; she who brought fear to the forests.

Name: Pays du Lunévillois: Le jeu
Description:
Pays du Lunévillois is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers of the Lunévillois:  Blâmont, Einville, Bayon... and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities....

The winner will have to be the first one to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

Name: Gone Bunkers
Description:
Gone Bunkers is a strategy card game. Players take turns building the ultimate hand until someone draws a war card and cannot defeat it. The deck is made up of all types of cards such as; troops, zombies, landmines and of course nukes! Even though your goal is to survive and fight off the war cards, it doesn't mean you can't nuke the player sitting next to you and destroy half their hand.

How to play:
Players take turns by drawing and playing cards until a WAR card is drawn from the deck. Once a WAR card is drawn, that player must defeat that WAR card. Be diplomatic to avoid the WAR, try to fight or be destroyed.

Taking your turn:
Gather all your cards into your hand and look at them. Do one of the following:
1. Draw from the draw pile. If it is a WAR card you can either play Diplomacy card and avoid the WAR or go to WAR and use your troops to defeat the WAR card. You must have the same or greater attack value (attack values are on troop cards) to win the WAR. If you cannot beat the WAR card's value, you lose.
2.Play a card FACE UP on the discard pile and follow the instructions on the card. Note: Zombie cards are placed in front of players not on the discard pile.

Winning the game:
Players will take turns drawing cards, builing their armies and surviving wars. Once one person loses all their cards then the person with the highest attack value (count up your troops attack values) left wins.

Gameplay variations:
Fight to the Death
Play until there is only one player left

15 Round Limit
Play 15 rounds and whomever has the highest attack value left wins

Gameplay Modes:
2 Player Mode
Start with 7 cards each. Each time a WAR card is drawn and a player wins at WAR or plays Diplomacy, put that WAR card back into the deck at random. This will ensure a player loses without the going through the entire deck.

Safe Haven Mode (Fan Favorite)
Do the same initial "Game Setup" except before putting the WAR cards back in the deck, place two cards, per player, face down on the side. Then, complete the regualar game setup and put those extra cards, per player, on top of the deck. This will ensure that each player gets two "safe" turns before a WAR card can be drawn.

Name: Les Trésors Arvernes
Description:
Les Trésors Arvernes
A great adventure in the heart of the Auvergne volcanoes. 
Search for 2 treasures: the Gallic shield and the Arverne boar, hidden in the middle of the Volcanoes. 
Choose your path well. 
But beware some may block your way. 
Be strategic and judicious in the decisions you make. 
Stay alert and don't get distracted. 
May luck be with you. 
Will you be the first to reach the Puy de Dôme to fly to victory? 
The treasure hunt is on.


Les Trésors Arvernes is a treasure hunt in the Auvergne Volcanoes Regional Nature Park. 
Goal : find the two treasures hidden under the domes.
Gameplay: players move using cards only. 
Transport cards (foot, bicycle, horseback) are numbered from 1 to 4 regardless of the means of transport.
When a player arrives on a dome, he discreetly lifts it to check if there is a treasure below...

Name: Wtht Vwls
Description:
Wtht Vwls is a simple word game for any number of players. At the start of each round each player thinks of a word and then writes the consonants in that word, in order, on a slip of paper for each other player.

After all slips have been distributed the players all try to come up with the longest possible word for each set of consonants; they may add any number of vowels before, after, or in between the consonants, but no consonants may be added and the order cannot be changed. (Y is always a vowel in this game.)

When one player has finished they announce the end of the round immediately. Players score a point for every letter in the words they found. An agreed-upon number of rounds is played.

Name: TRIBES（トライブス）
Description:
---You are a member of a tribe when humanity was still in its infancy.

We will efficiently collect resources for tribes to live in the harsh natural world and contribute to a rich life..... ---

This game is a resource management and trick-taking card game.

Each players creates several "roles" in the turn and decides the victory by the total of the points given for each "role".

Players use the Elements Cards (Fire, water, soil, wood) to collect resource cards for "Crystal", "Brick", "Apple", and "Charcoal".

After 3 rounds, the player who meets the 8 types of  and gets the most "contribution points" wins.

Name: バロニィ：スペシャルボックス (Barony: Special Box)
Duopento
Description: Each player receives a set of twelve tiles. Alternately, you have to place the stones on the board in such a way that you form as large a contiguous area of a color as possible. At the same time, one should prevent the opponent from doing the same. The tactic: to define as large areas as possible, in which only your own pentominos fit. The whole thing is finished when no one is able to accommodate one of his pentominos on the board.

Name: Death Ride Kursk: Sud-Front, Russland Staff Limited Edition
Description:
This game is the total collection of the Death Ride Kursk series of games showcasing the combat near the Kursk Salient on the southern shoulder.

Staff Limited Edition unique series package
A wooden box in the form of an 88mm ammunition crate
3 pockets within the box, one for each DRK game set (XLVIII, IISS, AD Kempf)
A hinged top with hasp for proper  and secure stowage
A piece of Red Army memorabilia
A piece of German Army memorabilia
Death Ride Kursk – Gross Deutschland
Death Ride Kursk – 3 rd Panzer
Death Ride Kursk – 11 th Panzer
Death Ride Kursk – XLVIII Enhancement
Death Ride Kursk – Totenkopf
Death Ride Kursk – Leibstandarte
Death Ride Kursk – Das Reich
Death Ride Kursk – IISS Enhancement
Death Ride Kursk – III Panzer Korps
Death Ride Kursk – Korps Raus
Death Ride Kursk – Armee Detachment Kempf Enhancement

Name: Guardiões da Terra
Description:
A didactic game to make as a family and teach the planet's values to the youngest.

"Shall We Save the Planet?

Pollution is getting stronger and Planet Earth is getting sicker.
Since you can't beat it alone, the Planet has summoned the Guardians of the Earth for an urgent cleaning mission.
Guardians have to act quickly and they need you.
Join them on this adventure and find out how you can help.
Learn how to clean beaches and seas with Solis and Gotas, discover "magic" foods with Bia, protect forests with Flora and become an expert in energy savings with Chamas.

Purpose of the game:
Players must move clockwise around the board to accumulate energy points and / or special "Guardian" cards.
There are two ways to win the game:
- Be the first player to get 50 energy points.
- Be the first player to acquire 6 special "Guardian" cards (one from each).
Players who run out of energy points immediately exit the game, as do their cards."

Name: Η Χιονάτη και οι 7 Νάνοι
Description:
Each player has to get first to the house of the 7 Dwarfs and save the Snow White before she bites the poisoned apple!

ΚÎ¬θε παÎ¯κτης πρÎ­πει να φτÎ¬σει πρÏŽτος με τους 7 νÎ¬νους στο τÎ­λος (σπÎ¯τι των νÎ¬νων στο κÎ­ντρο του ταμπλÏŒ)και να σÏŽσει τη ΧιονÎ¬τη που εÎ¯ναι Î­τοιμη να φÎ¬ει το δηλητηριασμÎ­νο μÎ®λο.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White

Name: Hey, Corona! USA
Description:
Born out of the odd experiences that hit the nation over the last few months, Hey Corona! is an outrageously fun card game where you try to stockpile as much toilet paper as you possibly can, while keeping yourself virus free by playing various action cards! Simple yet strategic, this game is great for all ages and perfect for socially distanced groups and families.

Save as much toilet paper as you possibly can in your "stockpile" of six face-down cards. Use action cards to switch out what you are hoarding and try to get rid of any cards with the virus.

At the end of each round, Toilet Paper Cards add points and Corona Cards take points away. Player with the most points at the end of 4 rounds wins.

From the Kickstarter and website descriptions.

Name: Meeples & Monsters: Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The peaceful city of Rowan is surrounded by dangerous monsters. It’s up to the citizens to fortify the city, train up warriors, clerics, knights, and mages, and defend Rowan in Meeples & Monsters!

Meeples & Monsters is a big, beautiful bag-building engine builder by designer Ole Steiness (Champions of Midgard and more). Depth, replayability, beautiful components, and a splash of meeple humor will have you coming back for “just one more play” game night after game night!

During a players turn, they draw meeples out of their bag and use those meeples to perform various actions on the board. Those actions include upgrading your meeples, adding new meeples to your bag, fighting monsters, investigating towers, or even upgrading the town, giving players even more options on future turns. At the end of a player’s turn, all the meeples they drew are put onto the “lodging” part of the player’s board.
 During the game, players will score victory points by defeating monsters, completing quests, and investigating towers. At the end of the game, players will score additional victory points by fighting boss monsters and through end-of-game quests. The player with the most victory points wins!

This Kickstarter edition includes a bunch of upgrades and extras, including the 4-towers expansion (20 tiles) and everything you need to play the solo version (7 Royal Guard Order Tiles, 1 Royal Guard Board).

—description from the publisher

NOTE: The retail edition can be found here: Meeples & Monsters.

Name: Market Garden
Description:
Operation Market Garden was a military operation fought in the Netherlands from 17 to 25 September 1944. It was planned by Field Marshal Montgomery as combined land - airborne operation. The airborne operation was undertaken by the First Allied Airborne Army with the land operation by XXX Corps of the British Second Army.

The operation's objective was to create a 103 km long corridor into Germany with a bridgehead over the River Rhine, creating an Allied invasion route into northern Germany. This was to be achieved by seizing a series of nine bridges with airborne forces, with land forces swiftly following over the bridges. Despite this ambitious plans, operation turned out to be a fiasco.
